item.title: Global airlines affected by major Airbus A320 recall
item.description: Europe's Airbus ordered immediate repairs to 6,000 of its widely used A320 jets in a sweeping recall affecting more than half the global fleet, threatening upheaval during the busiest travel weekend of the year in the US and sparking disruption worldwide. The fix mainly involves reverting to earli

item.title: 87,000 Bangladeshi expats registered so far to vote
item.description: Nearly 87,000 expatriate Bangladeshi voters from different countries across the world have so far registered through a mobile app, ‘Postal Vote Bd’, in the past 10 days to vote in the upcoming national election and the referendum. item.title: 1.4 million now jobless due to stalled industrialisation: A.K. Azad at economic conference
item.description: Industrial stagnation and shrinking private investment have caused 1.4 million (14 lakh) people to lose jobs, leaving them “wandering on the streets without employment,” Ha-Meem Group Managing Director and former FBCCI president A.K. Azad said on Saturday. Speaking at the opening sessi

item.title: Myanmar junta invites citizens abroad to return
item.description: Myanmar junta leader has said citizens living in the United States and other countries will be welcomed if they wish to return. The announcement came after the United States ended temporary protected status for nearly 4,000 Myanmar nationals earlier this week. Irrawaddy reported that speaking at

item.title: NRBC Bank achieves ‘Silver Rank’ in Asia Sustainability Reporting Rating-2025
item.description: NRBC Bank PLC achieved ‘SILVER RANK’ in Asia Sustainability Reporting Rating-2025 by National Centre for Corporate Reporting (NCCR), Indonesia, collaboration with the Institute of Certified Sustainability Practitioners (ICSP). Dr. Md. Touhidul Alam Khan, Managing Director & CEO o

item.title: Such uprisings may recur if people’s aspirations continue to be denied: NCP's Nahid at BEC
item.description: National Citizen Party (NCP) Convener Nahid Islam on Saturday said If people’s aspirations continue to be denied, such uprisings may recur as young people fight to reclaim their rightful prospects and future. “The previous ‘fascist government' had entrenched a discriminatory syst

item.title: Khaleda’s health condition still fragile, doctors report no improvement
item.description: The health condition of BNP Chairperson Begum Khaleda Zia, now undergoing treatment at Evercare Hospital in the capital, has not shown any significant improvement, according to her medical board members and senior party leaders. Doctors say the former prime minister is still suffering from pneumon

item.title: BRAC Bank and Sheba Merchants partner to empower SMEs through financing and technology
item.description: BRAC Bank has entered into a partnership with Sheba Merchants Limited to enable access to finance for SMEs associated with the Sheba Platform. item.title: Meghna Bank celebrates achievements of chairperson, vice chairman
item.description: Recently, Uzma Chowdhury, Chairperson of Meghna Bank PLC and Director, Finance of PRAN-RFL Group, has been awarded Bangladesh C-Suite Awards under the category of "Chief Finance Officer (CFO)/ Finance Director of the Year 2025". item.title: Dhaka Bank launches Bangladesh’s first-ever youth-focused dual currency prepaid card 'Spark' in partnership with Mastercard
item.description: Dhaka Bank PLC. in collaboration with Mastercard, has officially launched Bangladesh's first-everyouth-centric dual currency prepaid card, branded as “Spark”, at a grand launching ceremony held at a hotel at Gulshan on Monday, 24 November 2025. The Spark Card of Dhaka Bank design

item.title: BNP to stage ‘Victory Torch Roadshow’, grand rally on Dec 16
item.description: BNP will organise a nationwide ‘Victory Torch Roadshow’ along with a ‘grand rally’ on December 16 at Manik Mia Avenue in the capital to mark the Month of Victory. BNP Secretary General Mirza Fakhrul Islam Alamgir made the announcement at a press conference at the Part
